Description: Fragment of round handle of an Apulian pottery transport amphora at neck join. Clay fine purplish buff. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: For the type see Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) 172, 2. D. Manacorda and S. Pallecchi, Le fornace romane di Giancola (Bari, 2012) 306-7, A1. From the same die as British Museum 1955,0920.251. Trimmed. Name Archelaus.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1258)
